text.section: Subject to the limitations in this section and notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Treasurer may lend to a bank or securities broker any security that is owned by the State and is in the custody of the Treasurer.

section.section: The Treasurer and the bank or broker to whom a loan is to be made under this section shall make a written contract that governs the loan.

text.section: Consideration for a loan under this section may not be less than the current market lending rate for the securities on loan.

section.section: The bank or broker to whom a loan is to be made under this section shall deposit with the Treasurer collateral with a value that equals or exceeds the value of the securities on loan.

Collateral that may be used under this section shall be:
money; or
a security in which the Treasurer may invest under § 6-222 or § 6-223 of this article.
The Treasurer may enter into a contractual agreement with a financial institution to lend, as agent, securities owned by the State and in the custody of the Treasurer.
The financial institution shall provide security or indemnification acceptable to the Treasurer.
